result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Paid in full Dodge County Jail
findings and order sent to judge for review
Atty. Wilhelm heard on Def.'s payments status; requests $100 costs and IA; Court finds in contempt and imposes 30 days in jail with purge of $50/mo. biweekly by income assignment, $100 costs

for finding of contempt of court for failure to pay attorney services fees, for imposition of remedial sanctions, for costs on motion and for judgment; affidavit in support of motions; and order for hearing

Cases called 14CF267, 14CF290, 15CF150, 1:12 pm. Defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Adata Axelson and Jay Westhuis appears with TAD program.  Ms. Axelson is heard, requests full graduation.  1:26 pm, Yolanda Tienstra now appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Tienstra moves to dismiss with prejudice the TAD DPA.  Atty. Devitt is in agreement.  Court accepts Community service certificates on cases 14CF290 and 15CF150.  14CF267 - Court presents graduation certificate - case is dismissed with prejudice.

(10:36) 14CF267, 14CF290, 15CF150, 15CT75: Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is Sent. on 14CF267 (DPA) & 14CF290 and STC on 15CF150 & 15CT75; Amended Information filed in 15CF150; State heard - Joint recomm. on all and heard on same; Def. has valid DL; discussion held on other counts; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 1 Misd. BJ in 15CF150; Court finds plea in 15CF150 is made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Misd. BJ w/Count 2 dismissed; Court notes Counts 2, 3 & 4 in 14CF267 were to have been D&RI as of 1/9/15 plea hearing and so orders and 15CT75 is dismissed; State heard; Atty. Devitt heard; Court imposes sentence

14CF267: TAD DPA - no action, DPA cont. (Counts 2, 3 & 4 are D&RI as of 1/9/15)

14CF290: Misd. BJ - NC plea entered 1/9/15
 - 30 hours community service by 1/15/2016 (monitored by TAD DPA) - On or before 1/15/16, Def. must file a form that she has done CS, signed by authorized person 
- CC w/in 60 days or payment plan
- DNA surcharge

15CT75; Dismissed

15CF150: Misd. BJ (dismiss Count 2)
- Additional 30 hours CS by 1/15/16 - On or before 1/15/16, Def. must file a form that she has done CS, signed by authorized person 
- CC w/in 60 days or payment plan
- DNA surcharge

(1:33) 14CF267, 15CF150 & 15CT75: Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Devitt requests cases set for STC on 9/10/15 at 1:30 w/14CF290 & 14CF267 (DPA case); Court orders 15CF150 & 15CT75 set for STC on 9/10/15

(14CF267, 15CF134 & 15CT150) Defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews waiver filed in 15CF134  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing on September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

14CF267, 15CT75, 15CF150  Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Klomberg heard, Atty Devitt heard, state moves to quash warrant, court quashes warrant, Atty Devitt waives time limits for the preliminary hearing, court appoints Atty Devitt on this case, court does an initial appearance on 15CF150,   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within/waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 signature bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Court orders her to pay $500 down by 6/25 and court will review that on that date.    Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on May 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

1:32. (14cf267/290). Defendant, Melissa Braaflat, in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Attorney James T Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended info filed in 14cf290.  Court reviews stipulation w/ attorneys.  Court reviews PQ/WOR; pnlts + chrgs; DPA.  Deft pleads NC to Ct. 1 in 14cf290.  Court finds plea made f/v/k/i, accepts plea and finds Deft guilty.  Court dismisses Ct. 2 in 14cf290.  Deft pleads NC to Ct. 1 in 14cf267.  Court finds plea made f/v/k/i, accepts plea and places Deft on DPA.  Court ORDERS Defendant to comply with the program (to allow to bring back as contempt, not revocation).
Plea hearing on January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
for leave to file additional motions

14cF267, 290 Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

records.addlTxt: 14CF267, 290 Defendant, Melissa Braaflat in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court appoints Atty Mike Devitt, orders $500 down on 9/19, pay $50 every two weeks thereafter.

Defendant Melissa Braaflat in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (not eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within/waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1500 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
